welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.text: We're thrilled you've chosen ForSURE!\n\nHere's a concise guide to help you navigate through the software with ease.

help.title: Help
help.text: Should you have any question, feel free to revisit this guide at any point by clicking here

overview.title: Overview
overview.text: Welcome to your homepage! This space provides a snapshot of your data through various statistics, offering insights at a glance.

report.title: Create Report
report.text: This area allows you to either create a new report from scratch or upload existing data to be incorporated into your reports.

history.title: History
history.text: This page houses a comprehensive history of all your reports, enabling you to delve deep into the data for detailed analysis of each report.

categorylist.title: Categorylist
categorylist.text: Utilize this page to upload and modify your category list. It serves as the foundation for all reports and charts, so ensuring its accuracy and currency is crucial.

settings.title: Settings
settings.text: Given that your existing order list or category list may differ in format, this section allows you to customize the labels for each value to ensure consistency.

account.title: Account
account.text: Visit this section to review your account information and subscription details.

createChart.title: Create Chart
createChart.text: This section enables you to craft customized charts tailored to your preferences, using the data you supply.

yAxis.title: Select Y-Axis
yAxis.text: To try it out, start by dragging this element to the Y Axis

xAxis.title: Select X-Axis
xAxis.text: Next, proceed by dragging this element to the X Axis.

showChart.title: Show Chart
showChart.text: Upon completing these steps, the resulting chart will be instantly displayed.

chartOptions.title: Chart Options
chartOptions.text:
With these icons, you have the ability to: 
- Change the chart type, 
- View the chart in greater detail, and 
- Save the chart for immediate display below.

countryFilter.title: Filters
countryFilter.text: If your focus is on specific countries, you can apply the filter here. Choosing values will automatically refresh all charts to reflect your selections.

dateFilter.title: Filters
dateFilter.text: Similarly, for date filters, such as if you're interested in data from the last month, applying this filter will update all charts to match your specified timeframe.

profileFilter.title: Filters
profileFilter.text: Likewise, you can filter charts based on the source of your data, known as profiles, to tailor the displayed information accordingly.

reportsDue.title: Deadlines
reportsDue.text: This section displays the upcoming deadlines for EPR reports.\nIf the deadline field appears in blue, it indicates that our software has already generated the report, which can be found under the History section. If not, the report has yet to be completed.

example.title: Example
example.text:
Saving a chart will cause it to be displayed here alongside others.
This section offers a quick snapshot of all the metrics you're interested in. 
If you decide a chart is no longer needed, you can easily unpin it to remove it from view. For a deeper dive into a chart's specifics and to understand which orders have contributed to its data, click on the icon located in the top right corner.

Additionally, you have the option to rearrange the order of the charts by dragging the entire chart to a new position.

welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.text:
Welcome to the report page, where you have the flexibility to upload data from various sources and generate custom reports at your convenience.

To ensure a smooth process, please make sure to define the labels beforehand in the settings. 

You can either use the live data using the toggle or drag and drop a file here. After you select the profile and click next, the file will be uploaded and an error might be displayed. The uploading process can take a few minutes depending on the size of the dataset.

welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.text: Welcome to the download page. All reports that were automatically created or that you created manually are shown here.

inprogress.title: In Progress
inprogress.text: In the first table you find the reports that are in progress. That means that the report deadline has not been reached yet, but we create daily updates to show you how much data you are already reporting until now.

history.title: History
history.text: In this table you find reports that are done and can be evaluated and send to the corresponding scheme

country.title: Sorted by Country
country.text: The reports are grouped by country

debugger.title: Debugger
debugger.text: For each report you have a debugger that contains all raw data that was used in this report. This is especially important for audits.

report.title: Report
report.text: This is the actual report that can be sent to the reporting scheme.

open.title: Open
open.text: The first icon lets you view the report in full screen.

download.title: Download
download.text: The second icon lets you download the EPR report as Excel sheet.

share.title: Share
share.text: The third icon lets you share the report via mail.

delete.title: Delete
delete.text: The fourth icon lets you delete the report. If you do this, the report is deleted permanently and cannot be recovered.

send.title: Send
send.text: The last icon lets you validate and send the report to the correct scheme.

checkbox.title: Checkbox
checkbox.text: The checkbox lets you select multiple reports to do grouped downloads or deletion.

welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.text: On this settings page, you have the ability to define the labels for your order and category list, including specific details for each country. Additionally, you can set up a live connector to streamline your processes if desired.

profile.title: Profile
profile.text:
This dropdown menu allows you to select an existing profile or create a new one.

It's recommended to have one profile for each source of your data. For instance, you might have one profile for Shopify and another for WooCommerce, ensuring your data is organized by its origin.

To rename or delete a profile, simply click the pencil icon.

liveData.title: Live Data
liveData.text: This slider enables the use of live data. By turning it on, you can establish a direct connection to your Shopify store, ensuring real-time data synchronization.

connectorConfig.title: Connector
connectorConfig.text: In this section, you can input the URL of your Shopify store as well as the API token required for integration. For guidance on how to obtain these details, please refer to the following guide: Shopify Help Center - Custom Apps.

orderlistConfig.title: Orderlist
orderlistConfig.text: In this area, you have the option to specify the column names for your order list, which is necessary if you're not using live data. It's important to enter the column name exactly as it appears in the uploaded file, paying close attention to the use of lower/uppercase letters, to ensure it corresponds correctly to the data row.

returnlistConfig.title: Returnlist
returnlistConfig.text: This section allows you to define the column names for your return list, applicable if you are not using live data. Similar to order list setup, it's crucial to pay attention to the casing of the letters in the column names to ensure they match precisely with those in your uploaded file.

categorylistConfig.title: Categorylist
categorylistConfig.text: This area is designated for defining the labels for your category list. The category list can be uploaded in the categorylist tab and is the same for all profiles.\n\nOnly activate the Packaging, Batteries, and Electro if you need them.

categorylistCountryConfig.title: Categorylist
categorylistCountryConfig.text: For each country, there might be specific columns required in the category list to meet local regulations or reporting standards. In this section, you're encouraged to add the countries relevant to your operations and input the necessary labels for those columns. If certain elements, like Glass for example, do not apply to your sold products, you have the option to leave those columns empty, ensuring your category list is both accurate and compliant.

welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.text: This page is designed for uploading your existing category list and provides the tools needed to edit it, ensuring it conforms to the required format. It's a streamlined process for efficiently managing and updating your category data.

upload.title: Upload
upload.text: Simply click this button to navigate to your file selection. Once you've chosen the appropriate file, proceed to upload it here.

edit.title: Edit
edit.text: Here you have the flexibility to modify your category list by adding new rows or columns to better organize your data. To edit the content of any cell, simply double-click on it, allowing for quick and easy updates directly within your list.
